description.narrative:
The main goal of this project is to support and strengthen burundian civil society organizations (CSOs) in the context of the current crisis in the country.
This general objective is itself structured in two specific objectives: maintaining the achievements interms of capacity building and structuring of Burundian CSOs and their members; continuation by Burundian CSOs of advocacy, awareness-raising, monitoring of government policies and actions aimed at strengthening democratic values, respect for human rights, good governance, human rights and service delivery to cu;;unities.
The overall result of the project is that Burundian CSOs become effective and recognized partners in advocacy and lobbying in the area of good governance, human rights and service delivery to communities.
This overall result is supported by 3 intermediate results: R1: Civil society organizations are dynamic and operational even in a crisis environment R2 : Contribution to an environment conducive to the functioning of CSOs and the implementation of their actions, particularly at the provincial, communal and local levels, is provided. R3 : CSO participation in governance and community development is enhanced.
The main activities of the project are: Strengtheningthe technical and organizational capacity of CSOs through training, coaching and material support activities. Improved functioning of CSOs, particularly in relation to their practicies in ethics, accountability and engagement in networking. Depending onthe demands of CSOs, creating informal exchange frameworks: between CSOs, between civil society and authorities, and between state service providers and communities. Depending on requests from CSOs, support for organizing community awareness and advocacy activities on governance, CSO legal framework, fighting corruption, the role ofcivil society, human rights, etc

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
